title: Contributor Code of Conduct
text: contributors maintainers project, pledge respect people contribute reporting issues, posting feature requests, updating documentation, submitting pull requests patches, activities. committed making participation project harassment-free experience everyone, regardless level experience, gender, gender identity expression, sexual orientation, disability, personal appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion. Examples unacceptable behavior participants include use sexual language imagery, derogatory comments personal attacks, trolling, public private harassment, insults, unprofessional conduct. Project maintainers right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct. Project maintainers follow Code Conduct may removed project team. Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported opening issue contacting one project maintainers. Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant (https://www.contributor-covenant.org), version 1.0.0, available https://contributor-covenant.org/version/1/0/0/.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Nicholas Tierney. Author, maintainer. Amy Stringer. Author. Mike Cheng. Author. Laura de Jong. Author. Thomas Lumley. Contributor.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Tierney N, Stringer , Cheng M, de Jong L (2024). syn: Creates Synonyms Target Words. R package version 0.1.1,  https://github.com/njtierney/syn, http://syn.njtierney.com/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {syn: Creates Synonyms From Target Words},   author = {Nicholas Tierney and Amy Stringer and Mike Cheng and Laura {de Jong}},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.1.1,  https://github.com/njtierney/syn},   url = {http://syn.njtierney.com/}, }

title: Creates Synonyms From Target Words
text: syn zero dependency R package lists synonyms antonyms. two main functions: syn("great") Returns synonyms “great” ant("great") Returns antonyms “great”. syn ant take one word input. return synonyms many words, use plural form: syns, ants syns(c("great", "excellent") Returns named list synonyms “great”, “excellent” ants(c("great", "excellent") Returns named list antonyms “great”, “excellent”

title: Creates Synonyms From Target Words
text: syn function returns synonyms given word: Let’s look synonyms “cool”: Wow, lot! many ? Wow! 618 synonyms cool. ’s…self-restraint, guess. can also provide number words return n_words argument, randomly select number words given
code: library(syn)  syn_cool <- syn("cool")  head(syn_cool) #> [1] "abate"          "abnegation"     "above all that" "absolute zero"  #> [5] "abstinence"     "ace-high" tail(syn_cool) #> [1] "withhold"       "without nerves" "wizard"         "wonderless"     #> [5] "wonderlessness" "zealless" length(syn_cool) #> [1] 618 syn("awesome", 1) #> [1] "immortal" syn("awesome", 2) #> [1] "king-size"    "astronomical" syn("awesome", 5) #> [1] "prodigious"  "schrecklich" "infinite"    "lofty"       "magnified"

title: Creates Synonyms From Target Words
text: OK cool, let’s use sentence, using glue package. better?
code: glue::glue("This is really cool!") #> This is really cool! glue::glue("This is really {syn('cool', 1)}!") #> This is really guarded! glue::glue("This is really {syn('cool', 10)}!") #> This is really disinterest! #> This is really inexcitable! #> This is really gentleness! #> This is really icy calm! #> This is really undazed! #> This is really retiring! #> This is really cool off! #> This is really fine and dandy! #> This is really philosophic composure! #> This is really unimpressionable!

title: Creates Synonyms From Target Words
text: can generate synonyms multiple words syns function. takes vector words, returning named list can also provide n_words syns, return random selection words number.
code: syns_good_evil <- syns(c("good", "evil")) str(syns_good_evil) #> List of 2 #>  $ good: chr [1:667] "able to pay" "absolutely" "acceptable" "accomplished" ... #>  $ evil: chr [1:365] "aberrant" "abnormal" "abominable" "abomination" ... syns(c("good", "evil"),      n_words =  10) #> $good #>  [1] "warmly"               "heavenly"             "en rapport"           #>  [4] "goodish"              "splendid"             "careful"              #>  [7] "following the letter" "legitimate"           "fabric"               #> [10] "well-proportioned"    #>  #> $evil #>  [1] "Set"         "deleterious" "infection"   "dreary"      "illegal"     #>  [6] "abominable"  "infamous"    "degradation" "peccant"     "vileness"

title: Creates Synonyms From Target Words
text: create antonyms, use ant ants, inputs syn. However, stage, number antonyms available use ant small.
code: ant("good") #> [1] "bad"  "evil" ant("good",1) #> [1] "bad"  ant("strong") #> [1] "weak" ants(c("good", "evil")) #> $good #> [1] "bad"  "evil" #>  #> $evil #> [1] "good"  ants(c("good", "evil"), n_words = 5) #> $good #> [1] "evil" "bad"  #>  #> $evil #> [1] "good"  ants(c("strong", "weak")) #> $strong #> [1] "weak" #>  #> $weak #> [1] "strong"

what: Example: Filtering by the number of words in a synonym
title: Creates Synonyms From Target Words
text: Let’s say want filter something synonyms contain one word. can use n_words argument, calculates number words

title: Creates Synonyms From Target Words
text: Please note syn project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms.

what: Ant: Get antonyms for one word — ant
title: Ant: Get antonyms for one word — ant
text: Ant: Get antonyms one word

title: Ant: Get antonyms for one word — ant
Ant: Get antonyms for one word — ant
text: word character, one word want find antonyms . n_words integer, number words return.

title: Ant: Get antonyms for one word — ant
text: antonyms word entered. Returns character(0) word found

title: Ant: Get antonyms for one word — ant
code: ant("good") #> [1] "bad"  "evil" ant("evil", 25) #> [1] "good" # No words for spelling mistakes ant("spolling misteak") #> character(0)

what: Ants: Get antonyms for many words — ants
title: Ants: Get antonyms for many words — ants
text: Ants: Get antonyms many words

title: Ants: Get antonyms for many words — ants
Ants: Get antonyms for many words — ants
text: words word, character - many words want find antonyms. n_words integer, number words look .

title: Ants: Get antonyms for many words — ants
text: named list antonyms. Returns character(0) word found

title: Ants: Get antonyms for many words — ants

syn — syn
text: syn provides dependency free way get synonyms antonyms words.

title: syn — syn
syn — syn
text: word character, one word want find synonyms . n_words integer, number words look . integer Default words

title: syn — syn
text: synonyms word entered. Returns character(0) word found.

what: Syns: Get synonyms for many words — syns
title: Syns: Get synonyms for many words — syns
text: Syns: Get synonyms many words

title: Syns: Get synonyms for many words — syns
Syns: Get synonyms for many words — syns
text: words word, character - many words want find synonyms n_words integer, number words look . integer Default words

title: Syns: Get synonyms for many words — syns
text: named list synonyms. Returns character(0) word found.

title: Syns: Get synonyms for many words — syns
code: syns(c("good", "evil"), 10) #> $good #>  [1] "normative"     "grateful"      "desirable"     "blissful"      #>  [5] "nicely"        "recommendable" "hallowed"      "delightful"    #>  [9] "softheartedly" "competent"     #>  #> $evil #>  [1] "injurious"       "unrighteousness" "burden"          "misfortune"      #>  [5] "wickedness"      "curse"           "infamous"        "mortal sin"      #>  [9] "wrong"           "annoyance"       #>  # No words for spelling mistakes syns("spolling misteak") #> $`spolling misteak` #> character(0) #>

title: syn 0.1.0 “Antonym”
text: CRAN release: 2019-12-20 Implemented n_words count number words string. can useful subsetting synonyms. ensured words converted lowercase looked (#27) Easter Egg: Package name created syn::syn("synonym")[2]

title: syn 0.0.1 “Actual Thing”
text: Implemented ant ants functions using imported antonym dataset wordnet - see cool work Mike Cheng: #20. Add hex sticker, add improve upon website Zero dependencies Rewrite core data structure list integer vectors. brings package 5MB away need dynamic download/load infrastructure

title: syn 0.0.0.9000
text: Initial release ozunconf2018 Added NEWS.md file track changes package. Added syn syns tricks download install data words repo
